ngordnet

Class YearlyRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • ngordnet.YearlyRecord

  • public class YearlyRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the counts of a set of words for a given year. In this version of this file, we've made YearlyRecord into a delegating class. The theory here is that we want to be able to return counts(), words(), and ranks() all sorted w.r.t. counts in ascending order (for the sake of making Zipf's law plots) Having YearlyRecord extend HashMap doesn't quite do this for us. While we could add augmenting data structures to allow reverse lookups and so forth, once we need to be able to get the keySet() sorted by the values, things get awkward and the underlying data structure is no longer the natural and obvious choice.

      Records that WORD occurred COUNT times in this year.

      Returns rank of WORD.
      int size()
      Returns the number of words recorded this year.

      Returns all words in ascending order of count.
